{"step_by_step_thinking": "The child's symptoms include copious nasal discharge, coarse facial features, large tongue, bulging head, flattened nose, and enlarged spleen and liver. Document [28] describes Hurler syndrome, which includes symptoms such as coarsening of the facial features, a large head, a flattened nasal bridge, an enlarged tongue, and an enlarged spleen and liver. These symptoms match the child's symptoms closely. The other options do not match the symptoms as closely. Hypothyroidism can cause coarse facial features and a large tongue, but it does not typically cause a bulging head, flattened nose, or enlarged spleen and liver. Beckwith-Wiedemann syndrome can cause an enlarged liver, but it does not typically cause the other symptoms. Proteus syndrome can cause a large head and coarse facial features, but it does not typically cause a large tongue, flattened nose, or enlarged spleen and liver.", "answer_choice": "D. Hurler syndrome"}
